channel.title: hydrologic modeling on Asphota Wasti
channel.description: Recent content in hydrologic modeling on Asphota Wasti

item.title: Climate resiliency of a hydropower project
item.description: Climate Change Risk Analysis of a Hydropower Project in Nepal Hydropower projects face climate change risks due to changes in hydrology with increasing global temperature. To assess the impact on individual hydropower projects, a robustness-based bottom-up approach was introduced known as the Decision Tree Framework in 2015. In collaboration with Deltares and FutureWater, we at the University of Cincinnati analyzed the risks to a hydropower project in Nepal for the World Bank in 2019.

item.title: How to estimate flows in ungauged catchments?
item.description: Estimating Streamflow in the Ungauged Sub-basins of Arun Catchment Estimated the streamflow, evaporation, and infiltration along the stream channel in an ungagged glacierized catchment with a distributed hydrologic model, and global gridded datasets. Caption: Arun Catchment in Nepal
